items.name: NSW BioNet Flora Survey Data Collection
items.description: The NSW BioNet Flora Survey Data Collection is maintained via the Flora Survey Module of the NSW BioNet-Atlas application. This collection is a central, authoritative database for systematic vegetation survey data in NSW. Among other applications, this plot data is used to construct and maintain the quantitative Plant Community Type classification & Vegetation Integrity Benchmarks held in the BioNet Vegetation Classification Data Collection. These plots are also used to construct and update State Vegetation Type Maps held in the BioNet Vegetation Map Data Collection.

items.name: eAtlas - Australia's Tropical Land and Seas
items.description:
The eAtlas is a website and mapping system for presenting environmental research data in an accessible form that promotes greater use of this information. It is also a data management system for preserving and encouraging reuse of this data.
Decades of research have generated a large amount of data and information on the Great Barrier Reef and the terrestrial tropical ecosystems. Until now this information has generally been under-used. The eAtlas aims to promote collaboration and support the work of management agencies, researchers, reef-based industries and community groups.
From the site, users can discover what research is being done in a given region or on a given topic, then learn more about this research and its outcomes. The data behind the research can be investigated through an interactive mapping system and, where possible, the data itself can be downloaded. The eAtlas also contains a wide range of reference datasets that complement its research content.

items.name: QLD: Venomous Jellyfish Database - November, 2018 (NESP TWQ 2.2.3, CSIRO)
items.description:
This layer contains an extract of the public records of the Venomous Jellyfish Database compiled in November 2018 and shows the month of the sting event / specimen sample.
Note: Care should be taken in making conclusions about the spatial nature of the sting events as the data is incomplete (subset of all sting events) and influenced by the density and behaviour of people.

items.name: GBR: Marine bioregions reefs (GBRMPA, 2002)
items.description: This layer shows the bioregions of the reef areas in the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park.

items.name: Grey Reef shark (Carcharhinus amblyrhynchos)
items.description:
This layer shows the abundance of Grey Reef shark (Carcharhinus amblyrhynchos) across the Great Barrier Reef as measured with Baited Remote Underwater Video Stations (BRUVS). This was done as a study to compare fish abundance between pairs of shoals, one closed to fishing (Green zone) and one open to fishing (Blue zone). This layer is a summary of all the BRUVS data, aggregating all the BRUVS taken at each site (typically 12).
Note: The position of the sites has been rounded to 0.01 degrees to protect the sites from fishing.

items.name: Starry Triggerfish (Abalistes stellatus)
items.description:
This layer shows the abundance of Starry Triggerfish (Abalistes stellatus) across the Great Barrier Reef as measured with Baited Remote Underwater Video Stations (BRUVS).
This was done as a study to compare fish abundance between pairs of shoals, one closed to fishing (Green zone) and one open to fishing (Blue zone). This layer is a summary of all the BRUVS data, aggregating all the BRUVS taken at each site (typically 12).
Note: The position of the sites has been rounded to 0.01 degrees to protect the sites from fishing.
